justify:
证明 合理 
to provide or be a good reason for (something); to prove or show (something) to be just, 
right, or reasonable
criterion:
评判或作决定的标准，准则，原则 
a standard or principle by which something is judged, or with the help of which a decision 
is made
lest: 唯恐，以防 for fear that — used to say that you do not want something to happen
plummet:
垂直落下 
to fall suddenly straight down especially from a very high place 
130
faction:
派系，小集团 
a group within a larger group that has different ideas and opinions than the rest of the group
vantage:
优势，有利地位 
a position giving a strategic advantage, commanding perspective, or comprehensive view
be_impervious_to:
无动于衷的；不受影响的 
remain unmoved by 防渗漏的；不让穿过的 
be invulnerable to
grapple_with:
努力应对 
to deal with (something) usually skillfully or efficiently
outweigh:
在重要性或价值或重量上超过 
to be greater than (someone or something) in weight, value, or importance
halo:
晕，晕状物 
a circle of light round a person or thing, or something that looks like a circle of light

绘画中圣人、天使头上的光环，光轮 
a circle of light that is shown in pictures round the head of a holy figure such as a saint or angel
detain:
拘留 
to keep or prevent (someone) from leaving or arriving at the expected time

耽搁 
to officially prevent (someone) from leaving a place
duplicity:
奸诈，欺骗；表里不一，两面派 
dishonest behaviour that is intended to make somebody believe something which is not 
true; deceitfulness; double-dealing
blunt:
钝的 
having a thick edge or point; not sharp

直言不讳的 
saying or expressing something in a very direct way that may upset some people 
resort to 诉诸，采取 
to do something that you do not want to do because you cannot find any other way of 
achieving something
teeming:
大量的；充满移动着的人、动物等的；拥挤的 
present in large numbers; full of people, animals, etc. that are moving around
reciprocate:
回报，报答 
to do (something) for or to someone who has done something similar for or to you 
131
damp:
潮湿的；微湿的；湿气重的 
slightly wet, often in a way that is unpleasant

潮湿；潮气；湿气；湿块 
the state of being damp; areas on a wall, etc. that are damp
observe:
评述，说 
to make a comment about something you notice
iota:
微量；极少量 
an extremely small amount
guild:
协会 
an organized group of people who have joined together because they share the same job or interest
infallibility:
绝无错误，无过失 
absolute reliability; quality of being incapable of making mistakes
oscillate:
情感或行为摇摆，波动，变化 
to keep changing from one extreme of feeling or behaviour to another, and back again

摆动；振动 
to keep moving from one position to another and back again
potent:
强有力的 
very effective or strong
sack:
大麻袋，大厚纸袋 
a bag that is made of strong paper, cloth, or plastic

解雇，开除 
to dismiss (someone) from a job
relinquish:
放弃 
to give up (something); to give (something, such as power, control, or possession) to 
another person or group
symbiotic:
共生的 
the relationship between two different kinds of living things that live together and depend 
on each other
thrall:
奴隶，束缚 
the state of being controlled or strongly influenced by someone or something
embroil:
使卷入 
to involve (someone or something) in conflict or difficulties
annul:
取消，废止 
to say officially that something is no longer valid; to make (something) legally void 
132
endemic:
地方性的 
growing or existing in a certain place or region
scam:
欺诈，骗 
to deceive and take money from (someone)

骗局 
a dishonest way to make money by deceiving people
sacrilege:
亵渎神圣 
an act of treating a holy place or object in a way that does not show proper respect
toddle:
幼儿学步时摇摇摆摆地走，蹒跚行走 
(of a young child) move with short unsteady steps while learning to walk
enthrall:
迷住，吸引住 
to hold the attention of (someone) by being very exciting, interesting, or beautiful
velocity:
物 速度 
quickness of motion; speed
unflattering:
不讨好的，有损形象的，无法恭维的 
showing or representing unfavorably
discreet:
谨慎的 
careful not to cause embarrassment or attract too much attention, especially by keeping 
something secret
elapse:
时间 消逝，流逝 
(of time) to pass or go by
consecrate:
把 奉为神圣 
to officially make (something, such as a place or building) holy through a special religious ceremony
yardstick:
标准，评判尺度，准绳 
a rule or specific idea about what is acceptable or desirable that is used to judge or measure something
ordinance:
法令；条例；指示；训令 
an order or a rule made by a government or somebody in a position of authority
archetype:
典型；代表 
a perfect example of something
hitherto:
迄今 
until now; before this time 
134
cellular:
细胞的 
of, relating to, or made of the cells of living things
virile:
男子 强壮的，精力充沛的 
(of men) strong and full of energy, especially sexual energy

有阳刚之气的；有男子气概的；雄浑的 
having or showing the strength and energy that is considered typical of men
linger:
逗留，流连，不愿离开；花很长时间做某事 ，消磨 
to stay somewhere for longer because you do not want to leave; to spend a long time doing something

继续存留；缓慢消失 
to continue to exist for longer than expected; to be slow to disappear or die
variant:
变种，变体 
something that is different in some way from others of the same kind
outsmart:
智取，用计谋打败 
to defeat or trick (someone) by being more intelligent or clever
blockade:
封锁 
to stop people or supplies from entering or leaving (a port or country) especially during a war
propound:
提出 
to suggest (an idea, theory, etc.) to a person or group of people to consider; propose
fraudulent:
欺骗的 
done to trick someone for the purpose of getting something valuable
palatable:
美味的 
having a pleasant or agreeable taste

可以接受的，令人满意的 
pleasant or acceptable to someone
unfurl:
展开 
to cause (something that is folded or rolled up) to open
demeanor:
行为；风度；举止 
a person's appearance and behavior; the way someone seems to be to other people — usually singular
contented:
开心的，满意的 
happy and satisfied; showing or feeling contentment
hubris:
傲慢 
a great or foolish amount of pride or confidence 
135
errand:
差事 
a short trip taken to attend to some business often for another
prudence:
审慎，慎重 
the quality of being prudent; cautiousness
exotic:
外来的，异国情调的 
not living or growing naturally in a particular area; from another part of the world

奇异的 
very different, strange, or unusual
tedious:
单调乏味的 
tiresome because of length or dullness
partial:
偏袒的 
tending to treat one person, group, or thing better than another
unequivocal:
清晰的 
very strong and clear; not showing or allowing any doubt; not equivocal
deduce:
推论；推断；演 
to form an opinion about something based on the information or evidence that is available
enforce:
强行实施，强制执行法律、规定等 
to make (a law, rule, etc.) active or effective; to make sure that people do what is required

deface:
损伤 的外貌尤指乱涂、乱写 
to damage the appearance of something especially by drawing or writing on it
animate:
有生命的 
having life; alive or living

使活泼 
to make (someone or something) lively or excited
supervision:
监督 
the action or process of watching and directing what someone does or how something is done
devilish:
如恶魔般的 
evil and cruel 
136
unfettered:
无限制的；不受约束的；自由的 
not controlled or restricted
vulgar:
粗俗的 
not having or showing good manners, good taste, or politeness
complicit:
有同谋关系的，串通一气的 
Involved with others in an illegal activity
fortify:
加强 
to strengthen (a place) by building military defenses (such as walls, trenches, etc.)
intimate:
亲密的 
having a very close relationship; very warm and friendly

暗示 
to say or suggest (something) in an indirect way
dampen:
使 潮湿 
to make (something) somewhat or slightly wet

抑制，压制 
to make (something) less strong or active
hazard:
危险 
a source of danger
infrastructure:
基础设施 
the basic equipment and structures (such as roads and bridges) that are needed for a

be_wont_to:
习惯于 
be accustomed to doing
groove:
凹槽，槽 
long narrow channel, furrow

节奏，习惯，惯例 
routine, habit, fixed way of doing things
regressive:
退化的，倒退的 
tending to regress or produce regression
